summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 forwarding classified advertisements from 1997 and a 1996 traffic citation for Ghislaine Maxwell. The ads, which include a phone number matching the citation, were used in a Daily Mail story alleging Maxwell recruited staff who may have been involved in trafficking. The email is sent from Thomas Volscho to a US Attorney's Office contact.

persons.name: Thomas Volscho
persons.context: Sends email to US Attorney's Office with attached classified ads and traffic citation related to Ghislaine Maxwell, referencing a Daily Mail story.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named in a 1996 traffic citation and associated with phone number used in 1997 classified ads seeking staff such as a person to answer phones and do light cleaning.

persons.name: Christian
persons.context: Listed as the contact to call for full-time/part-time valet parker positions in Boynton Beach in a 1997 classified ad.

persons.name: Ms. Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as the contact to call for a position answering telephones and doing light cleaning during the holidays in a 1997 classified ad.

connections.description: Volscho sends research materials (ads and citation) to prosecutors regarding Maxwell, indicating an investigative or informational link.
The 'Ms. Maxwell' contact in the classified ad is very likely Ghislaine Maxwell, given the matching context and time period.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell traffic citation
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell received a traffic citation in 1996, which included a phone number.

events.title: Classified ads placed
events.description: Classified advertisements were placed in 1997, including one seeking a 'PERSON NEEDED TO ANSWER TELEPHONES & Do Light Cleaning' with contact 'Ms. Maxwell' and a matching phone number.

events.title: Daily Mail story published
events.description: The Daily Mail published a story alleging Ghislaine Maxwell launched a hiring drive to recruit staff who may have answered phones for trafficking operations, using the 1997 ads as evidence.

events.title: Email to US Attorney's Office
events.description: Thomas Volscho forwards the classified ads and citation to a US Attorney's Office contact, highlighting the matching phone number and referencing the Daily Mail story.

keyFacts: A 1996 traffic citation for Ghislaine Maxwell contained a phone number that matches the contact number in 1997 classified ads.
One 1997 classified ad sought a 'PERSON NEEDED TO ANSWER TELEPHONES & Do Light Cleaning Work During Holidays' with contact 'Ms. Maxwell'.

These materials were forwarded to the US Attorney's Office in 2021 in connection with a Daily Mail story alleging Maxwell recruited staff who may have been involved in answering phones for trafficking operations.
Other 1997 ads included positions for a pet store clerk, valet parkers (contact Christian), and a housekeeper/cook.
